intro: Linum virginianum var. floridanum, commonly known as Florida flax, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Florida flax is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
